result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber M. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Amber Rumpf for Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Amber M. Nelson did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends this matter to a County Ordinance DC.  Attorney Rumpf enters a no contest plea on behalf of her client.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders the following:  Forfeiture $395.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 a month commencing 4/1/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Amber M. Nelson in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the defendant does not have counsel.  Defendant to go directly to the public defenders office after court.  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: January 25, 2016

Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Amber M. Nelson in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
